abstract: The extent of sea ice in 2011 was the second-lowest on record; 2007 is still the record-holder.
snippet: The extent of sea ice in 2011 was the second-lowest on record; 2007 is still the record-holder.
lead_paragraph: The massive disappearance of sea ice has become one of the bellwether indicators of a changing climate, and for much of the year, it looked like this season might set a new record low for sea ice in the Arctic.
